blog.name: bushidohonorzine
blog.title: Bushido Honor: A Feudal Era Bnha Zine
blog.description:
Welcome to the remnant of the era where justice and honor thrive. This zine focuses on the feudal era of Japan, the way of the samurai, and the diversity of Edo Japan's culture.
Schedule|Interest Check|Mods application

title: 🌸Artist Applications🌸
body:
🗡️Gather around and listen closely as we depict a perilous tale of our young heroes during the prime of Japanese history. With your help, we will be able to see into their fates and foresee what kinds of lives they’ve lived!

🌸So, pick up your pen-like sword and show us how you strike true: here or 

  https://goo.gl/forms/qV1UT08JOltb6sWY2

🗡️Prove to us that you have what it takes to adorn the glory of Bushido!

🌸Applications close January 27th!

Writers apps Here

@fandomzines @bnha-community-board @uahigh-newsletter @zine-scene @zineapps @zinewatch @bnha-zine-scene @bnhabulletin @promotionbnha

- 🗡️The Mod Team🌸

tags: boku no hero academia x reader
summary:
50: "We'd make such a cute couple."
Your job wasn't always the most glamourous; you were a janitor, but you were a janitor at...
body:
50: “We’d make such a cute couple.”

Your job wasn’t always the most glamourous; you were a janitor, but you were a janitor at the best hero school in Japan. Born quirkless, you had always wanted to be close to heroes. So you joined the school in the only way you could: as part of the cleaning crew.

It was nice though. The teaching staff treated you well, and it was great to watch aspiring young heroes fulfill their dreams. You were a favorite among all the people there, but especially to one teacher in particular.

“If it isn’t YN! How’s my favorite janitor?” Hizashi Yamada, loud and boisterous as always, waved to you from down the hall. You had been cleaning one of the water fountains when he had spotted you. While you didn’t see every teacher every day, somehow you never failed to meet up with him.

“Doing just fine, and how’s my favorite teacher?” You really did enjoy his company. While loud, he was always so entergetic and gave you the boost you needed to get through the slowest of days.

“Fantastic! Y'know I was thinking, maybe we could go out to get coffee after work.” He was standing next to you now and he leaned against the water fountain, causing it to start. He jumped back in response, arms flailing for a moment, before he smiled sheepishly at you.

You giggled, biting your lip before replying, “And what had you thinking about that?”

“Well, it’s just that, you and I we’d make such a cute couple! So why not see where life takes us and start the journey.” Your face turned red; you hadn’t expected him to be so blunt. Your hands toyed with the tag in your hands, ringing it over and over as you stuttered on sentences.

“W-well that’s… Uhm, I mean sure, why not?” Hizashi gave a shout of joy, and then the two of you quickly exchanged numbers before he left to teach a class. You stared at your phone after he left, the smallest hint of a smile on your face. A cute couple huh? You’d love to see it.

summary: Hot Coco By The Fireplace / “What do you mean you don’t want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?” (Aizawa Shouta X Fem!Reader)
title: Hot Coco By The Fireplace / “What do you mean you don’t want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?” (Aizawa Shouta X Fem!Reader)
body:
Day 4  | December 16 - Hot Coco By The Fireplace / “What do you mean you don’t want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?”

a/n: Third part for my Christmas-y series, prompts hosted by @mha-xmas-challenge ! I had to slightly change up the prompts and kind of used both this time? Lol, anyway, hope you guys enjoy!

“Who’d have thought, huh…” you mumbled, taking the cup from Shouta as he reached it down towards you. Wrapping your hands around it, you proceeded to blow into the hot chocolate, making the steam curl over the borders of the cup. The warmth from both porcelain in your hand and the close-by fireplace lulled you into a pleasant state, though only when he carefully slipped onto the couch behind you, placing one arm around your waist, you felt at peace.

Sighing, you leaned back against his shoulders, while he took a sip from his own cup. From the corner of your eyes, you could watch him lick off some excess chocolate from his mouth, looking back at you with a surprised expression. “Did you just see that?” he asked and you nodded, giggling softly as you could see his cheeks flush.

When your laughter stopped, you leaned further back, stretching your neck to kiss the underside of his chin. Being so close to him was still very new, but you enjoyed every second of it. Ever since the Christmas party, the two of you have been going out, spending a lot of time by each other’s side, when you have the time for it.

Taking a sip of your own drink, you hummed as the sweetness spread inside of your mouth, captivating your mind and feelings quickly. Looking to your right you had a nice view of Shouta’s cup, noticing that, not like yours, it was missing. Interest spiking, you peeked a little closer, his eyes watching you as you leaned forward to inspect his cup. “There’s no whipped cream if you are searching for that,” he answered your question ahead of time, gaining a shocked gasp from your side.

“What do you mean there’s none? Do you not want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?” He only shook his head in reply as he lifted the cup to his lips again, sipping it. “No, that’s too sweet for my taste.” Another gasp escaped your mouth while he gave you a roll of his eyes. “Taste it, it’s perfectly fine without.”

Wrapping you into a full embrace, he placed the cup into your lap, waiting for you to take it from him. Skeptical, you brought it to your lips, making small sips, afraid to be shocked by the missing condiment. However, much to your own surprise, it was still good. Not exactly the best, but you couldn’t hold it against him for preferring his drink like this.

“It’s okay,” you judged, setting a heavy emphasis on it only being ‘okay’. “Well then,” he accepted your decision, taking the cup away from you again. For a while, the two of you remained in silent. Sometimes broken by the crackling of the fire and the rustling of the couch whenever either of you took a sip of your drink. After having had some of your own hot chocolate, the difference really stood out to his.

You couldn’t help but feel like he was right, the sweetness of your own being quite overwhelming. However, after drinking your hot chocolate this way for all these years, you felt quite complicated about changing it now. “Don’t you miss the sweetness?” you asked, staring into the brown liquid as it crafted little waves inside the cup.

“Why?” he returned your question, though you could hear a smile behind his voice without looking up. “Well, I mean, it’s a little bland, isn’t it. Completely without-” your babbling was interrupted by a shift in his posture before he sharply spoke up. “I don’t need more sweetness in my life. After all…” he paused, his hand coming to rest under your chin and he urged it up, so you’d look at him too.

Easily accessible now, he united his lips with yours, sending a shiver through your body as the rustic flavor spread through your mouth, paired with the intimate affection. He only paused shortly, moving inches away from you to finish his sentence.

“I have you now.”

Do you not want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?” He only shook his head in reply as he lifted the cup to his lips again, sipping it. “No, that’s too sweet for my taste.” Another gasp escaped your mouth while he gave you a roll of his eyes. “Taste it, it’s perfectly fine without.”

Wrapping you into a full embrace, he placed the cup into your lap, waiting for you to take it from him. Skeptical, you brought it to your lips, making small sips, afraid to be shocked by the missing condiment. However, much to your own surprise, it was still good. Not exactly the best, but you couldn’t hold it against him for preferring his drink like this.

“It’s okay,” you judged, setting a heavy emphasis on it only being ‘okay’. “Well then,” he accepted your decision, taking the cup away from you again. For a while, the two of you remained in silent. Sometimes broken by the crackling of the fire and the rustling of the couch whenever either of you took a sip of your drink. After having had some of your own hot chocolate, the difference really stood out to his.

You couldn’t help but feel like he was right, the sweetness of your own being quite overwhelming. However, after drinking your hot chocolate this way for all these years, you felt quite complicated about changing it now. “Don’t you miss the sweetness?” you asked, staring into the brown liquid as it crafted little waves inside the cup.

“Why?” he returned your question, though you could hear a smile behind his voice without looking up. “Well, I mean, it’s a little bland, isn’t it. Completely without-” your babbling was interrupted by a shift in his posture before he sharply spoke up. “I don’t need more sweetness in my life. After all…” he paused, his hand coming to rest under your chin and he urged it up, so you’d look at him too.

Easily accessible now, he united his lips with yours, sending a shiver through your body as the rustic flavor spread through your mouth, paired with the intimate affection. He only paused shortly, moving inches away from you to finish his sentence.

“I have you now.”
trail.content:
Day 4  | December 16 - Hot Coco By The Fireplace / “What do you mean you don’t want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?”

a/n: Third part for my Christmas-y series, prompts hosted by @mha-xmas-challenge ! I had to slightly change up the prompts and kind of used both this time? Lol, anyway, hope you guys enjoy!

“Who’d have thought, huh…” you mumbled, taking the cup from Shouta as he reached it down towards you. Wrapping your hands around it, you proceeded to blow into the hot chocolate, making the steam curl over the borders of the cup. The warmth from both porcelain in your hand and the close-by fireplace lulled you into a pleasant state, though only when he carefully slipped onto the couch behind you, placing one arm around your waist, you felt at peace.

Sighing, you leaned back against his shoulders, while he took a sip from his own cup. From the corner of your eyes, you could watch him lick off some excess chocolate from his mouth, looking back at you with a surprised expression. “Did you just see that?” he asked and you nodded, giggling softly as you could see his cheeks flush.

When your laughter stopped, you leaned further back, stretching your neck to kiss the underside of his chin. Being so close to him was still very new, but you enjoyed every second of it. Ever since the Christmas party, the two of you have been going out, spending a lot of time by each other’s side, when you have the time for it.

Taking a sip of your own drink, you hummed as the sweetness spread inside of your mouth, captivating your mind and feelings quickly. Looking to your right you had a nice view of Shouta’s cup, noticing that, not like yours, it was missing. Interest spiking, you peeked a little closer, his eyes watching you as you leaned forward to inspect his cup. “There’s no whipped cream if you are searching for that,” he answered your question ahead of time, gaining a shocked gasp from your side.

“What do you mean there’s none? Do you not want whipped cream on your hot chocolate?” He only shook his head in reply as he lifted the cup to his lips again, sipping it. “No, that’s too sweet for my taste.” Another gasp escaped your mouth while he gave you a roll of his eyes. “Taste it, it’s perfectly fine without.”

Wrapping you into a full embrace, he placed the cup into your lap, waiting for you to take it from him. Skeptical, you brought it to your lips, making small sips, afraid to be shocked by the missing condiment. However, much to your own surprise, it was still good. Not exactly the best, but you couldn’t hold it against him for preferring his drink like this.

“It’s okay,” you judged, setting a heavy emphasis on it only being ‘okay’. “Well then,” he accepted your decision, taking the cup away from you again. For a while, the two of you remained in silent. Sometimes broken by the crackling of the fire and the rustling of the couch whenever either of you took a sip of your drink. After having had some of your own hot chocolate, the difference really stood out to his.

You couldn’t help but feel like he was right, the sweetness of your own being quite overwhelming. However, after drinking your hot chocolate this way for all these years, you felt quite complicated about changing it now. “Don’t you miss the sweetness?” you asked, staring into the brown liquid as it crafted little waves inside the cup.

“Why?” he returned your question, though you could hear a smile behind his voice without looking up. “Well, I mean, it’s a little bland, isn’t it. Completely without-” your babbling was interrupted by a shift in his posture before he sharply spoke up. “I don’t need more sweetness in my life. After all…” he paused, his hand coming to rest under your chin and he urged it up, so you’d look at him too.

Easily accessible now, he united his lips with yours, sending a shiver through your body as the rustic flavor spread through your mouth, paired with the intimate affection. He only paused shortly, moving inches away from you to finish his sentence.

“I have you now.”
